result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Tomczyk Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT

No alcohol. No bars taverns or liquor stores. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No medications without a valid prescription. No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin Tomczyk Nelson in court, in custody.  Attorney James T. Sempf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Benjamin Tomczyk Nelson. Called @ 1:16 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing on all files - 21CF57, 22CF361, 21CF503. Record by Atty. Duquette as to agreement . Response by the State who is incompliance with victim's rights. No victims present in the Courtroom. Court goes over maximum penalties, deportation warnings.
Defendant responds to questions of the Court as to plea questionnaire. Attorney Duquette responds to Court's questions regarding plea and stipulates to the facts in complaint for factual basis. 
DEFENDANT PLEADS GUILTY TO COUNT #1 IN 21CF57
GUILTY TO COUNTS #1 AND #2 IN 21CF503
GUILTY TO COUNTS # 3 AND #3 IN 22CF36
ALL REMAINING COUNTS ARE DISMISSED AND READ-IN.
Court finds pleas to be knowing, voluntary, intelligent and finds defendant guilty.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement.
Court makes proper findings and adopts the agreed upon sentence - **SEE ATTACHED PLEA AGREEMENT**
Discussion as to turn in date and credit. Atty. Duquette will submit the form.
Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.

Defendant Benjamin Tomczyk Nelson appeared by video, in custody with Attorney James Duquette who appears in person.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford. Called @ 1:38 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment on 22CF361 and statuses on 21CF57 and 21CF503. Record by Atty. Duquette that the defendant is accepting the offer of the State and asks that all matters be put on tomorrow's 1:!5 call for plea and sentencing. Court grants request and sets all matters over. Court in recess.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

(6405) Defendant in court in custody via video with attorney James Duquette. ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is on for a preliminary hearing today on case 22CF361. Defendant has been advised of right to preliminary hearing and waives. Matter bound over for trial. Matter set over for arraignment on 22CF361, STC already set for 7-21 on 21CF503 & 21CF57.
Arraignment scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Tomczyk Nelson appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Benjamin Tomczyk Nelson. Called @ 1:56 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance/bond motion on 22CF361,and bond motion on 21CF57 and 21CF503. REcord by Atty. Duquette as to initial appearance on new file. He has gone over the charges and penalties with the defendant and will be seeking preliminary hearing, but will wait to schedule until after the bond motion is heard.
Record by the Court who goes over charges and penalties again with the defendant
Record/argument by Atty. Duquette as to bond motion. Objection by the State who makes further argument.
Response by the Court who denies the motion to modify bond at this time. 
Attorney Duquette requests preliminary hearing on speedy basis with pending files tracking to that date.
Court sets as requested. Court in recess.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Tomczyk Nelson appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg.  Attorney James B. Duquette in court for Benjamin Tomczyk Nelson. Called @ 1:25 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on 22GF649 (new charges), with 21CF57 and 21CF503 tracking. Record by Atty. Duquette as to his court appointment on pending files and asks the court to appoint him on the new referral as well, and set all matters over to Thursday @ 1:15 so he can file motion to modify bond. Response by the Court who appoints Attorney Duquette on new charges and sets all matters over as requested. Court in recess.
Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF649, 21CF503 & 21CF57

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.L. OR RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH E.J.L. dob 10-29-2003 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
